asteroids

Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • asteroids.Vector
      • asteroids.Direction

  • public class Direction
extends Vector
    A class of directions extending vector, involving an angle. A direction is a unit vector.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Tom Sydney Kerckhove & Xavier Go√°s Aguililla
    Invariants:
  • The magnitude of this direction is equal to 1. (It is a unit vector)
        Util.fuzzyEquals(getMagnitude(), 1.0)
  • The angle of this direction is a valid angle.
        canHaveAngle(getAngle())

        @Basic
@Raw
public void setAngle(Angle angle)

        Parameters:
        angle - The new angle for this direction.
        Precondition:
        The given angle is not null.
            angle != null
        Postconditions:
      • If this direction can have the given angle as its angle, then the angle of this direction is now equal to the given angle.
            new.getAngle() == angle
